title: crypto/x509: CRL generated by Certificate.CreateCRL is still version 1
body:
I think majority applications today that use certificate/CRL uses (or expects) version 2. 
Plus,I checked the source code of x509.go, the function CreateCRL uses pkix.TBSCertificateList, and [line 1650](https://golang.org/src/crypto/x509/x509.go?s=51461:51618#L1650) initialize the version =1. 
however according to the [Go DOC](https://golang.org/pkg/crypto/x509/pkix/#TBSCertificateList), quote here "TBSCertificateList represents the ASN.1 structure of the same name. See **RFC 5280**, section 5.1.", but [RFC5280](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5280#section-5.1) is profile for CRLv2, not v1. so I think if TBSCertificateList following RFC5280, then the created CRL should be v2.



following is the snip of a CRL generated by Go 1.5.2  on windows/amd64:
[SVR ~]$ openssl crl -in crl.crl -text -inform der|more
Certificate Revocation List (CRL):
        **Version 1 (0x0)**
    Signature Algorithm: sha256WithRSAEncryption
        Issuer: /CN=EXAMPLEROOTCA
        Last Update: Nov 10 23:00:00 2009 GMT
        Next Update: Nov 10 23:00:00 2019 GMT
        CRL extensions:
            X509v3 Authority Key Identifier: 
                keyid:9B:C9:78:89:2F:90:86:71:98:77:87:19:98:CC:E8:09:A9:48:95:12

Revoked Certificates:
    Serial Number: 01
        Revocation Date: Nov 10 23:00:00 2010 GMT
    Serial Number: 02
        Revocation Date: Nov 10 23:00:00 2010 GMT
....
